text:
My first time here, after seeing it on social media so often. The idea is not new but still impressive enough when seeing it with your own eyes.
I was there during the long weekend holiday, but still feel very spacious and not over crowded. There are probably more books for the young readers and children but I also saw a wide range of books for adults & topics.
Inside that impressive lighted bookshelf is a hidden "book room" for children. Even more impressive, it is 2 levels of hidden "book room". There's also a cafe (wolf cafe) in the corner and a piano by the window, surely anyone, young or old, can find their interest in this store, whether you like books or not.

Such a wonderful place. Many books and great ambience. Most affordable prices for books i have ever seen in the region. A must go space for book lovers.

The grand piano is a plus and when i was there someone played a wonderful sequence.

Spacious and have a lot of good books at a reasonable + affordable price. It's aesthetic in every corner. A lot of kid's books and there is a piano beside the big glass window inside the shop. I went there on Sunday, not too crowded.

The books are very cheap and the interior is very pretty = instagrammable. The staff are helpful as well in helping us to find that you're looking for. However, the book collections are limited, a significant part of the collections are catered towards children and not a lot of science/technology non-fiction.

what a place ti take pictures. most of yhe spot is instagrammable pictures and many books there are to my appearance s. the staff friendly and let us go in with food but need to mention early. there's also got piano for anyone want to play.
